question: What is Dayananda Sagar University?
answer: Dayananda Sagar University (DSU) is a private university in Bengaluru, Karnataka, offering undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral programs in engineering, management, health sciences, basic and applied sciences, design, law and more.

question: Where is DSU located?
answer: DSU is located in Bengaluru, Karnataka. The main campus is at Harohalli on Kanakapura Road, and there is also a City Innovation Campus near Kudlu Gate on Hosur Road.

question: What are the main schools at DSU?
answer:
DSU has several schools:
• School of Engineering
• School of Computer Applications
• School of Commerce & Management
• School of Basic & Applied Sciences
• School of Health Sciences
• School of Arts, Design & Humanities
• School of Design & Digital Transmedia
• School of Law
• Online Degree Programs unit

question: What undergraduate programs are offered at DSU?
answer:
Some of the key undergraduate programs at DSU include:
• B.Tech (various specialisations)
• BBA
• BCA
• B.Com
• B.Sc (Biological Sciences and other science streams)
• B.Sc Nursing
• B.Pharm
• Pharm.D
• BPT (Bachelor of Physiotherapy)
• BA Journalism & Mass Communication
• Design and media programs

question: What postgraduate programs are available at DSU?
answer:
Some of the key postgraduate programs at DSU include:
• M.Tech in selected engineering branches
• MBA
• MCA
• M.Sc programs in Biological Sciences and Data Science streams
• M.Sc Nursing
• M.Pharm
• MPT (Master of Physiotherapy)
• Other PG programs as notified each year

question: Does DSU offer online degree programs?
answer:
Yes, DSU offers online degree programs such as:
• BBA (Online)
• BCA (Online)
• B.Com (Online)
These are designed for students who need flexible learning options.

question: How can I apply for admission at DSU?
answer: You can apply for admission at DSU through the online admissions portal on the official DSU website. Depending on the program, admissions may be through DSAT (Dayananda Sagar Admission Test), COMEDK, Karnataka CET, PGCET or direct / NRI and foreign admissions.

question: What is DSAT in DSU admissions?
answer: DSAT stands for Dayananda Sagar Admission Test. It is DSU’s own entrance exam for certain undergraduate and postgraduate programs. Students register for DSAT, take the test and then attend counselling based on their performance.

question: What entrance exams are accepted for B.Tech at DSU?
answer:
For B.Tech programs, DSU typically accepts:
• DSAT
• COMEDK
• Karnataka CET (KEA)
In some cases, limited management or NRI seats are also filled as per university rules.

question: What is the basic eligibility for B.Tech at DSU?
answer:
For B.Tech at DSU, a candidate should normally:
• Have passed 10+2 / PUC or equivalent
• Have Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects
• Have one more subject like Chemistry / Biology / Biotechnology / Computer Science or similar
• Meet the minimum aggregate percentage specified by DSU and regulatory bodies for that year

question: Does DSU provide hostel facilities?
answer: Yes, DSU provides hostel facilities for both boys and girls. The hostels offer furnished rooms with different sharing options, Wi-Fi, security and mess facilities. Hostel fees depend on the campus, type of room and occupancy.

question: What facilities are available in DSU hostels?
answer:
Common DSU hostel facilities include:
• Furnished rooms with different sharing options
• Wi-Fi internet
• Mess facility (vegetarian and non-vegetarian options, as notified)
• Security and wardens
• Common rooms and recreation areas
Details can vary by hostel and campus.

question: Is DSU a ragging-free campus?
answer: Yes, DSU follows a strict anti-ragging policy as per UGC guidelines. Ragging is not tolerated and any reported incidents can lead to disciplinary action, including rustication as per rules.

question: Does DSU provide placement support?
answer: Yes, DSU has a Training and Placement cell that works with companies to provide internships, training sessions and campus recruitment opportunities. The cell also focuses on aptitude, soft skills and interview preparation.

question: Does DSU support research and Ph.D programs?
answer: Yes, DSU encourages research and innovation. It offers Ph.D programs in several disciplines across engineering, sciences, management, health sciences, law and other areas, supported by research centres and qualified guides.

question: Are scholarships available at DSU?
answer: Yes, DSU offers scholarships and fee concessions to eligible students. These can be based on academic merit, entrance exam performance and other criteria announced by the university in each academic year.

question: How is student life at DSU?
answer:
Student life at DSU typically includes:
• Classroom learning and labs
• Projects and research work
• Technical and cultural fests
• Sports and clubs
• Workshops, seminars and industry talks
This makes for a mix of academic and co-curricular activities on campus.

question: How can I contact DSU for admission queries?
answer: You can contact DSU through the admission helpline numbers and email given on the official DSU website, commonly including a main admission support number and admissions@dsu.edu.in. There are also dedicated contacts for NRI and foreign admissions.

question: Tell me about DSU in simple words.
answer: Dayananda Sagar University is a Bengaluru-based private university that offers many programs in engineering, health sciences, management, science, design and law. It focuses on good academics, modern labs, research, placements and overall student development.

question: Why should I choose DSU?
answer:
You might choose DSU if you are looking for:
• A variety of programs in one university
• Modern labs and infrastructure
• Focus on projects, research and internships
• Active campus life with clubs and events
• Placement and soft skills training support

answer:
Courses offered:

question: List all courses offered by the School of Design & Digital Transmedia at DSU.
answer:
Courses offered:

• Other creative and digital media programs as notified

question: List all courses offered by the School of Law at DSU.
answer:
Courses offered:

question: List all online degree programs offered by DSU.
answer:
Courses offered:
• BBA (Online)
• BCA (Online)
• B.Com (Online)

question: What is the approximate fee for B.Tech at DSU?
answer: B.Tech fees at DSU can vary based on branch, quota (CET, COMEDK, DSAT, management) and academic year. As an approximate idea, the total fee per year for B.Tech is usually in the range of around 1.5 to 3.0 lakh INR per year for many categories, but you must check the latest official DSU fee notification or contact the admissions office for the exact current fees.

question: What is the approximate total fee for programs like B.Com or BBA at DSU?
answer: For programs like B.Com or BBA, the total course fee over the full duration is usually in the range of 4 to 5 lakh INR, with the first-year fee often around 1.5 lakh INR or more, depending on the batch and category. Exact fees can change every year, so it is important to refer to the latest DSU fee structure on the official website.

question: What is the approximate fee for MBA or other postgraduate programs at DSU?
answer: For MBA and other postgraduate programs at DSU, the total fee typically depends on the program and admission category. As a very rough idea, the full program fee for MBA may be in the range of 4 to 6 lakh INR or more, while M.Tech and other PG programs usually have slightly lower or similar ranges. You should always confirm current fees through the official DSU admissions or fee structure page.

question: What is the approximate hostel fee at DSU?
answer: Hostel fees at DSU vary according to campus, hostel, room type and occupancy. As an approximate range, annual hostel accommodation fees are typically between about 70,000 INR and 1,60,000 INR per year. In addition, there is a separate mess or food fee and a refundable caution deposit. The exact amount for your batch and hostel will be given in the official hostel fee notification.

question: What is usually included in the DSU hostel fee?
answer:
In most cases, the DSU hostel fee covers:
• Accommodation for the academic year
• Mess or food charges (breakfast, lunch and dinner as per rules)
• Basic hostel facilities and utilities
The exact inclusions and any extra charges like laundry or transport, if applicable, are mentioned in the hostel fee notification for that academic year.

question: Are hostel fees at DSU refundable if I leave in between the year?
answer: As per typical hostel rules, hostel fees are generally to be paid for the full academic year and are usually not refunded if a student leaves mid-year. However, the caution deposit is normally refunded at the end of the stay, subject to hostel rules. You should read the current DSU hostel notification and rules for precise terms.

question: How do I find the latest fee structure for my program at DSU?
answer: To get the latest and most accurate fee structure, visit the official DSU website and go to the admissions or eligibility and fee structure section, or contact the DSU admissions office directly. Fees may differ by program, quota and year, so always rely on the latest official notification rather than older documents.

question: List of courses at DSU
answer:
Dayananda Sagar University (DSU) offers programmes through multiple schools:

1. School of Engineering
2. School of Computer Applications
3. School of Commerce & Management
4. School of Basic & Applied Sciences
5. School of Health Sciences
6. School of Arts, Design & Humanities
7. School of Design & Digital Transmedia
8. School of Law
9. Online Degree Programs unit
10. Medical College (CDSIMER)

You can also ask, for example:
• "List all courses offered by the School of Engineering at DSU."
• "List all courses offered by the School of Commerce & Management at DSU."
• "List all courses offered by the School of Law at DSU."
so that the chatbot shows the courses for a particular school in a clean column-wise list.

question: What courses does the college offer?
answer:
DSU offers a wide range of programmes across different schools:

1. School of Engineering – B.Tech and M.Tech programmes in Computer Science & Engineering, AI & ML, Data Science, Cyber Security, AI & Robotics, ECE, Mechanical, Aerospace and related specialisations.

2. School of Computer Applications – BCA, MCA and related computer applications programmes.

3. School of Commerce & Management – BBA, B.Com, MBA and management-related programmes.

4. School of Basic & Applied Sciences – B.Sc and M.Sc programmes in Biological Sciences and other science disciplines.

5. School of Health Sciences – Nursing, Physiotherapy, Allied Health Sciences, Pharmacy and related health science programmes.

6. School of Arts, Design & Humanities – BA Journalism & Mass Communication and other arts and humanities programmes.

7. School of Design & Digital Transmedia – Design, digital media and transmedia programmes.

8. School of Law – BA LL.B, BBA LL.B, LL.B and law-related programmes.

9. Online Degree Programs unit – Online BBA, BCA, B.Com and other flexible learning programmes.

10. Medical College (CDSIMER) – MBBS and other health science programmes.

For detailed lists, you can also ask school-wise questions like "List all courses offered by the School of Engineering at DSU."

question: What is the B.Tech 2nd year tuition and academic fee at DSU for the 2024-25 academic year?
answer:
According to the official DSU fee notification for the 2023-24 B.Tech batch (2nd year, Academic Year 2024-25), the Tuition & Academic fee (including exam fee) is as follows:

• B.Tech – CET Quota: ₹1,27,574
• B.Tech – COMEDK Quota: ₹2,97,000
• B.Tech – DSAT Quota (Mech / EC / AE): ₹2,47,000
• B.Tech – DSAT Quota (CS / AIML / CY / DS / CST / RO & AI): ₹2,97,000
• B.Tech – Others (CS / AIML / CY / DS / CST / RO & AI): ₹3,72,000
• B.Tech – Others (Mech / EC / AE): ₹3,37,000

These values are specific to the 2nd year of B.Tech for the mentioned academic year and batch. For other years or batches, students should refer to the latest DSU fee notifications.

question: What are the last dates to pay the B.Tech 2nd year fees at DSU for 2024-25?
answer:
For the 2023-24 B.Tech batch (2nd year, Academic Year 2024-25), the last dates for paying the Tuition & Academic fee are:

• Last date to pay without fine: 10 September 2024
• Last date to pay with fine: 30 September 2024 (fine of ₹100 per day)

Payments are to be made online through the DSU ERP Student Login (UMS). In case of difficulty in online payment, students may also pay via demand draft as per the instructions in the notification. Always check the latest DSU notice for any changes.

question: How should I pay my B.Tech 2nd year fees at DSU?
answer: As per the DSU fee notification for B.Tech 2nd year (AY 2024-25), the fee should normally be paid online through the DSU ERP Student Login URL (UMS portal). In case of difficulty with online payment gateways, the university allows payment by demand draft in favour of "Dayananda Sagar University" payable at Bengaluru. Students should follow the exact instructions and dates given in the latest official notification and retain the payment acknowledgement.

question: What rules should students know about DSU hostel fees?
answer:
Important DSU Hostel Rules (as per official notification):

• Full hostel fee + mess fee + deposit must be paid together
• Student’s full name must be written in payment remarks
• Card payments include bank convenience charges
• Mess system is 3-meal mandatory
• Hostel fees are non-refundable
• Mess and hostel fees must be paid separately
• Cash payments are not accepted

question: What are the placements like at DSU?
answer: DSU has a strong placement record: over 450 companies visited campus in recent years, with the highest package reaching around ₹35 LPA. More than 300+ students were placed in the placement drive, and DSU’s average package stood at around ₹5-6 LPA in the 2024 season. Top recruiters include Amazon, Capgemini, Cognizant, Infosys, Deloitte, EY, Mercedes-Benz and many more. Visit the official DSU placement page for detailed batch-wise statistics. (Source: DSU campus placements overview).
